member.name: P:DotNetCore.CAP.RabbitMQOptions.HostName
member.summary: The host to connect to. If you want connect to the cluster, you can assign like “192.168.1.111,192.168.1.112”

member.name: P:DotNetCore.CAP.RabbitMQOptions.Password
member.summary: Password to use when authenticating to the server.

member.name: P:DotNetCore.CAP.RabbitMQOptions.UserName
member.summary: Username to use when authenticating to the server.

member.name: P:DotNetCore.CAP.RabbitMQOptions.VirtualHost
member.summary: Virtual host to access during this connection.

member.name: P:DotNetCore.CAP.RabbitMQOptions.ExchangeName
member.summary: Topic exchange name when declare a topic exchange.

member.name: P:DotNetCore.CAP.RabbitMQOptions.QueueArguments
member.summary: Optional queue arguments, also known as "x-arguments" because of their field name in the AMQP 0-9-1 protocol, is a map (dictionary) of arbitrary key/value pairs that can be provided by clients when a queue is declared.

member.name: P:DotNetCore.CAP.RabbitMQOptions.CustomHeaders
member.summary: If you need to get additional native delivery args, you can use this function to write into .

member.name: P:DotNetCore.CAP.RabbitMQOptions.QueueArgumentsOptions.QueueMode
member.summary: Gets or sets queue mode by supplying the 'x-queue-mode' declaration argument with a string specifying the desired mode.

member.name: P:DotNetCore.CAP.RabbitMQOptions.QueueArgumentsOptions.MessageTTL
member.summary: Gets or sets queue message automatic deletion time (in milliseconds) "x-message-ttl", Default 864000000 ms (10 days).
